alert.note: Alert for Luce (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 10:36AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT TODAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...northeastern Luce County in Upper Michigan. * WHEN...Until noon EDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams. Minor water flowing over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1030 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated continued heavy rain due to thunderstorms, resulting in small stream flooding. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2.5 and 3.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.75 to 1.75 inches are expected over the area in the next two hours and will result in additional minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northeastern Luce County - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
